page.title: 02Cockermouth Our Market Town
page.content: Cockermouth is situated where the River Cocker joins the River Derwent . The town is famed for its flowerbeds lining the streets, its nearness to the lakes, and as the place where William and Dorothy Wordsworth were born.It is the main shopping area for the surrounding villages. Farmers sell their livestock at the auction market. Many tourists come to Cockermouth to see the attractions like Wordsworth House, Cockermouth Castle, the Market and the nearby Lake District. The Cumbria Fire Services H.Q., the Police Station, the Town Hall, Allerdale Council Offices and the Cottage Hospital are all important to the town of Cockermouth and the villages around it. Cockermouth Secondry School serves a wide area and children from villages like Brigham and Eaglesfield are educated there.
